body.name: Tell No Lies: A Novel (Quinn & Costa Thrillers Book 2)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Third to Die Tell No Lies The Wrong Victim Seven Girls Gone The Missing Witness Stay on the edge-of-your-seat with more suspense novels from Allison Brennan Quinn & Costa #1 Quinn & Costa #2 Quinn & Costa #3 Quinn & Costa #4 Quinn & Costa #5 A notorious serial killer is back Quinn & Costa work to uncover possible ties to a high-stakes cartel in the Southwest desert. A lethal attack with no clear motive…and a killer dead-set on keeping the truth buried. When nobody will talk and corruption runs deep, turning to outsiders is the only way to make sure women stop disappearing… When a key witness goes missing, Quinn and Costa must find her before a killer silences her for good…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Starts slow, then takes off!
reviews.reviewText: Discovered the first book in this series after reading another unrelated book by Brennan. The first Quinn & Costa book was a page turner from the beginning. This one took me longer to get into due to many moving parts & pieces that seemed a bit disconnected. However, when the story lines merged this one became a great thriller as well.Looking forward to reading Quinn & Costa Book 3.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So much going on
reviews.reviewText: A murder the FBI is investigating is thought to have occurred to hide the dumping of toxic waste. But as the investigation continues there is more ... murder, drug smuggling, human trafficking, kidnapping. and more. Follow the investigation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Incredible Thriller for Quinn & Costa
reviews.reviewText: I loved Tell No Lies by Allison Brennan, the second book in her Quinn and Costa series. Tell No Lies kept me on the edge of my seat and up many late nights reading. Allison Brennan as once again proven that she is a wonderful storyteller who always delivers truly page turning thrillers. I loved every page and could not put it down. Tell No Lies is filled with all those things that we have come to love and expect in a Allison Brennan thriller. Especially the poignant and bittersweet moments that filled this page turner, and the many surprise plot-twists. Tell No Lies is the story of the newly created D.C. based FBI mobile response team, under the leadership of Mathias "Matt" Costa, and team members: L.A. detective Kara Quinn, white-collar crimes expert Zack Heller, team analyst Ryder Kim, veteran Navy SEAL Michael Harris, and forensics expert Jim Esteban. The team is in Patagonia, Arizona trying to solve the murder case of Emma Perez. The investigation starts with the premise of illegal dumping of slag by Southwest Copper. Kara is working undercover as a bartender at The Wrangler, the local bar and Michael is working his first undercover case inside Southwest Copper. Matt is working with Joe Molina, the son of the owner of Southwest Copper, John Molina. The case takes some surprise twists and turns, and it ends up being so much more that illegal dumping. I love how the team is able to gather the information and connect all the pieces of the case together to find the killer and what is really going on in Patagonia. I love that there is a hint of a relationship between Matt and Kara. Cannot wait to see what happens between them in the coming books. Like all of Allison Brennan's, Tell No Lies is filled with incredible characters, thrilling plot twists and unexpected turns of events. I really love everything about this series and cannot wait for the upcoming books in the series. Allison Brennan continues to amaze me with her writing and to deliver incredible thrillers. Highly recommend this thriller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I picked this because I live near the location it is set, but I couldn't put it down
reviews.reviewText: This book is set in a location near where I live and includes some historical sites in the plot. But it was the story wonderfully told that kept me reading. From some real profound experiences for some characters and a look at a couple of major issues that actually happen to people all the way through the characters that I now love. I was looking for a book to read but I found a series I must have. And since I am going on a pre-planned camping trip to Patagonia, Arizona tomorrow, I am going to tell everyone there that I see about this. And downloading the other books in the series. A wonderful job by Allison Brennan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved this book. It kept me turning pages till the end. I can't wait until the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not the Author’s Best Book
reviews.reviewText: I normally like Allison Brennan books, but this one was so slow that it was actually boring until page 221. Normally her books have my attention on page 1. There are too many plots going on in this book, and too many characters to keep track of. And the main characters aren’t described the same as the first book in this series, which is both disappointing and odd. The setting is desert landscape, so it’s all dirt and run down buildings. Definitely not my favorite book by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of my favorite authors.
reviews.reviewText: Believe able characters and story line.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love all the main characters. Quinn and Costa are my favorites they blend so well. Can’t wait to read the next book, about to start right now!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 8, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I love this new series by Allison Brennan, Third to Die was a brilliant introduction to the mobile response team and Tell No Lies is an equally brilliant second book. The story is full of twists and turns and what starts of as a simple murder case soon becomes something far more complex for Matt Costa and his team. The story flows wonderfully and I love the way all the team play their part, it’s also great that the chemistry between Matt and Kara isn’t really focused on, it’s just m entioned in passing. A fascinating complex twisty turny suspense novel that keeps you on the edge of your seat till the last page
First book i have read of Allison Brennan and it was a great read, so much going on and all good characters, very well written, i am hooked

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 18, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Loved this 2and installment in the Quinn and Costa universe. I twisting mystery and all the ends meet up spectacularly. And I know so much about the dining habits of vultures
I always enjoy Novels by Allison Brennan and this lived up to expectations
Brennan is my newest can’t miss author Big book (500+pages)and great plot There are a lot of characters so need to pay attentionGreat plots
